Provenience: Napoli, Tomba del Tuffatore, p. 164, figs. 88Non Sepcified89
Imagery Description: (a) HalfNon Sepcifieddraped Dionysos seated on a palmette beside a table, with phiale in r. hand and thyrsus in 1., between to 1. a bearded silen, who leans forward in front of him, with the reed of a flute in his r. hand, a phiale and wreath in his 1., and a thyrsus, and to r. a standing maenad, with an egg in her r. hand and thyrsus in 1.; suspended above is a white female mask (Type SS) to r. (b) Dionysos with thyrsus and egg, young satyr with phiale of eggs in r. and egg in 1.
